result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon A. Gaston

records.addlTxt: Proposed Order on Request to Appear Remotely (Victim HC)

Cases 22CF1046 (Clark) and 22CF1047 (Gaston) called. Defendant Tracey A Clark appeared by video, in custody in Taycheedah Correctional Institution.  Attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond in court for Tracey A Clark.  Attorney Katherine Cook in court for Tracey A Clark.  Attorney Zebulon Patek in court for Tracey A Clark. 
Defendant Brandon A. Gaston in court, in custody In Eau Claire.  Attorney George E. Miller in court for Brandon A. Gaston. 
Attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Chad D Verbeten in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant (Clark) waives their right to appear in person and Court accepts waiver. 
State calls Officer J. Henning to testify- is sworn and testifies. Record to reflect identification of Clark and Gaston by Officer Henning. 
Exhibit one is offered by the State- No objection from the Defense. Exhibit received. 
Attorney Cook conducts cross-examination of Officer Henning. 
Attorney Miller conducts cross- examination of Officer Henning. 
Re Direct by the State. Re Cross by Attorney Cook. Re Cross by Attorney Miller. 
Witness is excused. State has no other witnesses and asks for bind over. 
Attorney Ryan Raymond argues against bind over for Clark stating the elements the State must prove are absent from the testimony given. 
Attorney Miller states he agrees with Attorney Raymond and makes argument to support. 
Court makes a statement regarding the State's burden and binds both matters over to Branch 6 (Wickstrom) for ARGN.
Dated 10/17/2022, Letter from Court to Attorney George Miller denying request to reschedule preliminary hearing.
State's Response in Opposition to Defense's Request to Reschedule Prelimary Hearing
Dated 10/14/2022. Letter from Attorney George Miller to Court requesting to reschedule preliminary hearing.
Copy of State's letter filed in 22CF1046 regarding defense's request to reset preliminary hearing.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Notice of Assignment of Judge - Return to Sender, Not Deliverable as Addressed, Unable to Forward
Preliminary hearing on October 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

0200pm Defendant Brandon A. Gaston in court, in custody.  Attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for State of Wisconsin. 

The Public Defender's Office has just recently been able to find counsel. State asks that good cause be found to extend the time limits for the preliminary hearing. Court finds good cause to extend the time limits in this case. Counsel will be able to appear with Defendant at the next court hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
The Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender Services. Despite best efforts, the State Public Defender Office has not yet secured representation for this Defendant.
Notice of Appearance of Co-Counsel Assistant Attorney General Chad Verbeten

11:10am Defendant Brandon A. Gaston appeared by video, in custody from the Eau Claire County Jail with Attorney Erika Amundson.  District Attorney Peter Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives reading of the complaint. State requests a one million dollar cash bond. Court orders one million dollar cash bond with conditions. 
Preliminary Hearing set. 
Court indicates that the record will reflect that the time limits regarding the Preliminary Hearing are extended for good cause as there are differing opinions regarding if weekends count towards the 10 day time frame.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Conditions: 
No contact with co-defendant Tracey Clark or any members of her family.
No contact with any member of victim D.S.'s family.
